author: potuz
content: I think this is fundamentally wrong unless "free" here means it requires no resources, a 10 year old can click on a Windows icon and it will sync immediately and start working flawlessly and if the user makes a mistake there will be a million barriers the software puts to prevent this (sending to a wrong address, network, paying too much gas, etc). I venture to say this will **never** happen and users will always be centralized no matter what the protocol does

author: sky.cactus
content: That is why I mentioned that "free" was a hypothetical extreme to illustrate the point.

author: sky.cactus
content: The closer we get to that hypothetical free, the better.  Just because it isn't achievable in the purest sense doesn't mean there isn't value in striving for it.

author: potuz
content: That I agree, but the centralization aspect I think is something we'll have to live with forever

author: sky.cactus
content: To some extent, yes.  However, I think we can make huge gains with in-browser light clients.

author: sky.cactus
content: If most dapps can operate without a centrally run node that is a huge win IMO.
